pageContext.claim: “And we have the largest GDP by far, especially since we've increased it by so much since a thing called the election.  Our GDP has gone way up.  And so the fact that our GDP went way up, that means we're paying for even more, which is very unfair.”
pageContext.analysis: There's a lot that is mixed up in this statement. In 2017, GDP grew 2.3 percent, but that is on par with GDP growth since 2010. And while nations have committed to spend a certain percentage of GDP, that spending is not automatically correlated to increases in GDP. Each country sets it's own defense spending.
